item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Gets Second Update
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-gets-second-update/

Bethesda and MachineGames have released the second update for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. Available on both Xbox Series X|S and PC, the game’s second update makes a few changes to the game’s graphics, missions, and platform-specific issues on both PC and Xbox.

In addition to the update, Bethesda says that those using OBS Studio to record gameplay could experience crashing when trying to capture the game. Players should make sure the software is updated to OBS Studio Version 31.0.0 to prevent the crashes.

You can check out the full update details below via Bethesda.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Update Details

General

  • Fixed an issue where users Game Slot may be reported as being damaged, or may appear to be completely missing, when no actual problem had occurred.

Gameplay

  • Fixed an issue where player may be unable to equip Indy’s whip.
  • Fixed an issue where a player may end up with Indy’s camera permanently equipped.
  • Fixed an issue where player may drop and lose their camera if they use the quick-equip (“key item”) prompt to equip their camera while they are inspecting another nearby pick-up item.

Graphics

  • Fix to prevent “Double vision” getting stuck on screen when Indy has almost drowned. To players who have already encountered this issue, repeating the near-drown should clear the issue.
  • Some further improvements to reduce “stutter” from duplicated frames during cutscenes.

Missions and quests – Please note this section contains some small spoilers

  • Fixed an issue where Gina may not approach the secret entrance to the Vatican Treasure Chamber, blocking the mission from progressing.
  • Fixed an issue where Gina may go to pick the lock to the exit from the Vatican Treasure Chamber as soon as you enter the room, meaning you may miss some very important story developments.
  • Fixed a big hole in the floor collision around the edge of the wall around the Ziggurat in Sukhothai that the player could fall through.

PC Specific fixes

  • Fixed an issue where Nvidia DLSS may cause performance problems when enabled.
  • Fixed an issue where Nvidia Frame Generation wasn’t activated properly if HDR is in use.
  • Fixed an issue where Nvidia Low Latency Mode could cause performance problems when used with Frame Generation.
  • Fixed an issue where global illumination may be completely disabled when playing with below minimum VRAM graphics cards.
  • Fixed an issue where Lighting may be over bright in interior spaces if Path Tracing (Full Ray Tracing) is set to Medium or High Quality.
  • Known Issue: Nvidia Frame Generation may be temporarily disabled if HDR is activated for the first time. To work around this issue, disable and then re-enable DLSS. This only needs to be done once.

Xbox Specific fixes

  • Improvements to Global Illumination on Xbox, to fix issues where shadowed areas had appeared brighter than expected.

A new report claims that Sony is getting set to release more previously-exclusive PlayStation games on Xbox in 2025.

Skibidi Toilet Is Coming To Fortnite This Week

A new leak reveals that Skibidi Toilet will be coming to Fortnite in December as a skin with a couple accessories.

Elden Ring Nightreign Can Only be Played Solo or as a Trio

Elden Ring’s Game Director Junya Ishizaki has revealed that Elden Ring Nightreign can only be played as a trio or solo.

Borderlands 4 Will Cut Back on ‘Toilet Humor’ Says Gearbox

Gearbox’s Narrative Director says it will reduce toilet humor for its next installment in the Borderlands series, Borderlands 4.

item.title: More PlayStation Exclusives Are Coming To Xbox Next Year, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/more-playstation-exclusives-are-coming-to-xbox-next-year-its-claimed/

Xbox owners could be getting their hands on more PlayStation-exclusive games in 2025.

In a new report from Jez Corden of Windows Central, sources have told him that there will be “more unannounced and previously PlayStation-exclusive games” coming to Xbox Series X|S next year.

News of PlayStation exclusives coming to Xbox shouldn’t surprise anyone. Over recent years, both sides have continued to release games on the competing platforms. Recently, Genshin Impact finally made its debut on Xbox after being console exclusive to PlayStation since 2020. Another PlayStation exclusive, Predator: Hunting Grounds, released on Xbox in 2024 after four years as a Sony exclusive.

As of now, it’s unclear if Corden is referring to first-party or third-party games making their way to Microsoft’s consoles.

On the other side of the coin, Microsoft is bringing exclusives like Indiana Jones and the Great Circle to PlayStation 5 in 2025. There are also rumored plans for Forza Horizon 5 to make its way to the console as well.

What PlayStation games do you think will make their way to Xbox Series X|S in 2025? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our preview of the upcoming Revenge of the Savage Planet. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Skibidi Toilet Is Coming To Fortnite This Week
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/skibidi-toilet-is-coming-to-fortnite-this-week/

One of the most popular memes is making its way to Fortnite as Skibidi Toilet is coming to the game. According to Fortnite leaker SpushFNBR, a Skibidi Toilet bundle will be available in the game starting on Wednesday, December 18.

Players will be able to buy the full bundle for 2,800 VBucks or a la carte. The main piece of the bundle is a Plungerman skin for 1500 VBucks that includes a LEGO variant and a Skibidi backpack. Also available is a Skibidi Toilet backpack for 600 Vbucks and a Plungerman’s Plunger pickaxe for 800 Vbucks.

As of publishing, Epic Games has yet to confirm the release of the bundle. If and when that happens, this article will be updated with full details.

The continued growth of Skibidi Toilet shouldn’t come as a surprise to anyone. Earlier this year it was announced that a Skibidi Toilet TV show and movie were in the works at a major studio.

What do you think of Skibidi Toilet coming to Fortnite this week? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our preview of the upcoming Revenge of the Savage Planet. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
